alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 2:18PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. East Walker River Above Strosnider Ditch Near Mason affecting Lyon County. Humboldt River Near Imlay affecting Pershing County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated flows caused by snowmelt is expected to continue. * WHERE...West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding of lowlands pasture & rural roads in West Walker River Canyon and Antelope Valley including Walker, Coleville and Topaz California. Roughly similar to late May 2005, and slightly below peaks of June 2010 and May 2006. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM PDT Monday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 5.7 feet early Friday morning. Higher flows are expected by Friday night into next weekend. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when camping or hiking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon.
